comment:
Best professor at KSU. She's Fair, Tough, & Happy. She actually cares about the student's learning. She is not indoctrinated by American higher academia. She'll cut you a break if she sees that you are actually trying. Knock out the homework, go to class, go to office hours, and you'll be fine.
Exams and quizzes are veryy similar to the homework.

Easily the best professor I've ever had. Lectures are engaging worth going to. The workload is not super heavy, and none of the exam questions are out of left field. If you go to class, do the homework, and review for the exams, you will do great. Prof. Tekes is funny, helpful, and more than fair. She teaches difficult courses, but makes them easy.

Professor Tekes is simply hands down the best professor at KSU. She is very helpful and willing to work with any student who may be struggling in her class. Her lectures are top notch and the tests reflect exactly what's on the test so just come to class, take notes, and study and you will pass. I wish every teacher could learn from Tekes!

Best professor to ever take for this class. Show up, and I guarantee you will succeed easily. Never had to study a lot, and Dr. Tekes is the best at lecturing and keeping things interesting and fun. Her exams were very reflective of class material, and minimal hw. Also posts all of her notes and recorded lectures online!

I completely understand why people love her, I really do, but she is not as good as these ratings make her seem. She's a really sweet lady, and her lectures are fine, but she's unreliable. She goes back on her word a lot, and maybe that doesn't bother you, but it bothered me. I personally would never take her again.

Best Organized professor you will ever have in the engineering field. She is prepared and really knows the material. I enjoy the class and learn a lot. only class that I enjoy learning because she makes the material interesting and easy to follow. "You Guys Awesome" positive vibes. I took her in summer, she gives everyone that you need to get A.
Lots of labs but it still and easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: She's the best
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is probably the best professor I have every had. She is very knowable, energetic, and you can tell you really cares. She adapted very well to the mix or online and in class lectures. Gives very well thought-out and easily understood lectures. I have had her for 2 classes now and she only got better.
Shes wonderful. Ive never had a professor care more about their subject and students as much as she does. Take her if you want actual understanding and not just a grade on a transcript.
"Don't worry, everyone. You are going to love this problem!" -Dr. Tekes every time she does an example problem

Dr. Tekes was one of the best professors I had. She dedicates her full attention to teaching and bases her research on Vibrations Lab (ME4501). She was also the best in making the class hybrid due to COVID-19. She was very caring, answered all questions, and gave lots of example problems. My only complaint is that she did not give us candy.

Both one of my favorite professors and hardest professors. She is brilliant and it's not her fault that she has to present a boatload of info in such a small time. She will take every minute of class to lecture. She always posts her lectures, however, do not rely on them to skip and self-learn. You need her explanations behind the slides and info
one of the best teacher in KSU. if you want to learn Control theory, you should take her class, no regrets at all!

Really enjoys teaching and is evident in the lectures. If you pay attention the lectures are very very clear and progressive to where you won't be confused. I wish all ME classes would have been like this one. Recommended 100%
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: She does not know how to present the material and will get mad if you ask her questions.

I am pretty sure there is one angry student here, and I think I know who that person is. (you will all know who I am talking about if you are taking this course right now. It is that obvious). This kind of student and this kind of behavior really make me not to trust rmp any more.

She is an incredible teacher. She gave an entire lecture on the design of cylinders. Ive never understood a shape better. Take her if you want to learn control theory. Dont take her if you want an A without doing any work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Tekes is an amazing teacher! She really knows her stuff and also knows how to teach in a way that students can actually understand. I took her for Dynamics and really learned the material. I was really confused when I saw her rating was low, but I realized the low ratings were from 1 very upset student trying to drive her score down :/
Phenomenal Professor! One of the best at KSU. Take her you wont regret it!

Listen, if you're not going to work in a class, and then go on here to bash actual, good professors, I really don't get it. This teacher is not only a caring, and engaging professor, but she is a super sweet and helpful person too. Don't know what all this cylinder talk is, but if you're looking to get a degree the right way, take this professor.

Great professor, I am still taking this class but she prepares you for whatever may come on the test. She gives credit where she can, she wants you to pass. Put in time and you will pass no doubt. Best professor I have had so far.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors at KSU.

You will learn something in this class weather you like to or not. the way she teaches kind of pulls you in to start calculating. The class test are straight forward you will have plenty of time to get hw done. And you will be able to apply most of what you learned here to your Senior design project. Double win. Stop thinking about it sign up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the Best Professors available for Mechanical Engineering students at KSU! I would take her for the entire 4 class series that she teaches starting with Mathlab, Dynamics, Vibrations and Vibrations Lab, Control Theory. Don't be afraid to use you cell phone to record her in-class lectures. It helps! Solves a lot of examples!! She is great!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best teachers at KSU. I took her for Machine Dynamics and Vibrations because a friend of mine strongly recommended her. This class was fantastic. I learned a LOT in this one. I ended up taking her for Controls, as well as the Vibrations lab. Seriously, my favorite teacher at this school. Best attitude of any teacher EVER!

Tekes indeed was a gem of a professor. As many know, dynamics is not an easy class concept-wise, especially the latter half of the course. However, she is an extremely generous grader (90% of the time) & is very understanding of students. Only thing to beware is she is very strict when it comes to her note sheet requirements for quizzes and tests.

Professor Tekes-Matlab; she was extremely helpful! She gave us lots of opportunities to practice and she was a fair grader. At the end of the course, we had a final project. She was a little harsh with feedback in front of the whole class, but most people in the course did do well at the end of the semester.

I took Professor Tekes for Dynamics. She knows the material very well  and is very personable. She makes herself available to answer any questions you may have. An awesome teacher all around! She has my highest recommendation!!!!

Ayse Tekes is a new teacher At SPSU but she is awesome. i was a a little Afraid of this class because of previous classes, but she made it Fun and easier than i expected.  She not the Best Teacher but she do her best to help you past the quizzes and test.

Professor Tekes is new but she is very knowledgeable for the material. She will help you understand and doesn't expect you to know everything. Take good notes and practice the PowerPoint examples then  you should be fine. She also helps during tests if you get stuck
